Because there is no objective focal deficit, no emergency investigations are mandated. Further testing is directed at excluding structural or inflammatory central nervous system disease if the history is concerning, and at identifying reversible systemic contributors. Imaging is the key screening tool; basic blood tests help exclude metabolic, infectious, or autoimmune mimics. More invasive tests such as lumbar puncture or EEG are reserved for cases where history or imaging raises specific concern.
